content:
Down Dog is a great app! There are many excellent yoga YouTube channels and online resources that can help you deepen your practice and stay motivated. Here are some popular ones:

**YouTube Channels:**

1. **Yoga With Adriene**: Adriene offers a wide range of classes, from beginners to advanced, with a focus on mindfulness and self-care.
2. **Dylan Werner Yoga**: Dylan's classes are challenging, yet accessible, with a focus on strength, flexibility, and alignment.
3. **Fightmaster Yoga**: Lesley Fightmaster's classes are dynamic, energetic, and perfect for those who want to build strength and endurance.
4. **Yoga Girl**: Rachel Brice's classes are a great blend of yoga, meditation, and self-reflection, with a focus on mindfulness and inner awareness.
5. **Seane Corn**: Seane's classes are a beautiful blend of yoga, spirituality, and activism, with a focus on social justice and community building.

**Online Resources:**

1. **Yoga International**: This website offers a vast library of yoga classes, articles, and tutorials, covering various styles and levels.
2. **DoYouYoga**: This platform offers a wide range of classes, workshops, and courses, with a focus on yoga, meditation, and wellness.
3. **Gaia**: Gaia is a membership-based platform that offers a vast library of yoga classes, meditation sessions, and documentaries on spirituality and wellness.
4. **YogaGlo**: YogaGlo offers a wide range of classes, from beginners to advanced, with a focus on yoga, Pilates, and meditation.
5. **Omstars**: Omstars is a yoga platform that offers classes, courses, and workshops, with a focus on yoga, meditation, and mindfulness.

**Apps:**

1. **Down Dog** (you're already using it!)
2. **Yoga Studio**: This app offers a wide range of classes, customizable practices, and a pose library.
3. **Pocket Yoga**: This app offers a comprehensive pose library, customizable practices, and a focus on yoga philosophy.
4. **YogaGlo**: The YogaGlo app offers a wide range of classes, with a focus on yoga, Pilates, and meditation.

Remember, it's essential to listen to your body and modify or rest when needed. It's also a good idea to consult with a healthcare professional or yoga therapist before starting a new practice, especially if you have any injuries or health concerns.

I hope you find these resources helpful in deepening your yoga practice!
